flow.descriptionCdata:
a599fc15-fa23-450c-8db9-176573fa4535.168000cf-791d-4cb7-93ee-3febeada4c24.description=
Retrieves the configured number of CPUs for a virtual machine.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).

Responses\:
success - Successfully retrieved the number of CPUs configured for the virtual machine.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
vmCpuCount - Number of CPUs configured for the virtual machine

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
a599fc15-fa23-450c-8db9-176573fa4535.4ba85862-87f1-4851-a3ea-27dd3437ef4b.description=Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested. Input Parameters\: serviceName -name of the service that will be created with this flow VCenterHost - vCenter host to execute against VCenterUsername - vCenter username VCenterPassword - vCenter password. virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed. dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs cpuCount - number of cpus the virtual machine should have. memSize - amount of memory the virtual machine should have. addDisk - whether or not disk should be added to the vm. Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: NA a599fc15-fa23-450c-8db9-176573fa4535.6e6dae4e-590b-47f1-b56f-827d1e7519e2.description=
Subtracts two numbers

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
The difference of the two numbers.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
a599fc15-fa23-450c-8db9-176573fa4535.9f2643a8-52ee-46e9-b5ec-07a374be50bd.description=
Checks if a number or word is greater than another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 > value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
a599fc15-fa23-450c-8db9-176573fa4535.description=
This flow runs a flex up cpu or a flex down cpu action on a target VM. The user input for cpuCount is taken as the desired state of the target VM. If the desired state and the actual state is the same, then the user input is ignored.

Inputs\:
host		\: The hostname or IP address of the vCenter provider
user		\: The name of the user account to login to the vCenter provider
password		\: The password of the user account to login to the vCenter provider
cpuCount		\: The cpu in number that the server should be flex to
virtualMachine	\: The ID of the target VM on which flex cpu action should be run
vmDatacenter	\: The name of the data center that contains the target VM
port		\: The port used by the vCenter provider
protocol		\: The protocol used by the vCenter provider
availableCPU		\: The cpu that is available for flex operations on the vCenter provider. If set to -1, then the vCenter will not be checked to see if it has the cpu required for a successful flex up cpu action.

Response\:
success		\: Flex cpu action succeeded for the target VM
ignored		\: Flex cpu action was not executed on the target VM as it has the same cpu configuration as the desired configuration
failure		\: Flex cpu failed on the target VM
a599fc15-fa23-450c-8db9-176573fa4535.e36ea236-e3e8-4a77-ba4c-69286f2f0386.description=
Checks if a number or word is less than another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 < value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
a599fc15-fa23-450c-8db9-176573fa4535.fe3831d8-7661-4143-b901-0cd79452c516.description=
Checks if a number or word is less than another number or word. Word comparison is case-sensitive in alphabetical order.

Inputs\:
value1 - The first value.
value2 - The second value.

Returns\:
value1 < value2

Responses\:
success - The boolean operation was evaluated to true.
failure - Something went wrong or the boolean operation returned false.
flow.name: vCenter Flex CPU

step.name: Subtract VM CPU from User Input
Is Available CPU Less Than 0 (used as a flag)
